description.narrative: Output 6.4: Strengthened economic capacity for the most vulnerable households, including those affected by HIV and AIDS, to protect children from practices that expose them to violence, abuse and exploitation in target districts.

sector.narrative: Public finance management for child protection

UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
2018 Zimbabwe: Zimbabwe's Harmonised Social Cash Transfer Programme: Endline Impact Evaluation Report

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 6.4: Strengthened economic capacity for the most vulnerable households, including those affected by HIV and AIDS, to protect children from practices that expose them to violence, abuse and exploitation in target districts.

description.narrative: UNICEF supported 28,683 households, covering 55,301 children (27,829 girls & 27,472 boys), with cash transfers that improved their economic capacity to care for children as well as enhanced their access to and utilization of protection services offered through the cash and care approach. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:13/01/2020
